title: Tantara 2016 Zotovich Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of white peach, gardenia, jasmine and butter are leveled by a sharp lemone note on the nose. The palate is tense at first, eventually releasing waves of butter, lemon balm and melon, proving creamy and bright at once.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Daphne Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a great vintage for this limited selection of old-vine Pommard clone Pinot Noir. Pretty raspberry and cherry fruit anchors the flavors, with superb length, texture and detail. Grace notes of rhubarb, earth and herb seem to develop into the background as the wine breathes.

title: Thiénot 2006 Vigne aux Gamins Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This low-production wine comes from a small Chardonnay vineyard in the Côte des Blancs. It shows the beauty of mature Chardonnay, with the minerality totally subsumed by the richness and elegance of the texture. It's ready to drink now.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2015 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)
description: Produced, like all Alphonse Mellot wines, from biodynamically grown grapes, this single-vineyard bottling is rich, full of black fruits and dense tannins. The stony soil is unusual for a Pinot Noir and gives a dark, complex texture to the wine that will take some time to soften. Drink from 2022.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)
description: A single-vineyard wine from one of the highest points in Sancerre, this is concentrated and dense, full of taut fruit and rich acidity. Apple flavors are cut with tangy, spicy citrus lifted by the taut aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Le Paradis  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is richly endowed with ripe yellow and quince flavors, tightly textured and concentrated. The fruit dominates although there is also room for the tight texture that will soften. Drink this rich wine from 2019.

title: Bergström 2016 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Full bodied and complex, this mixes raspberries and cherries with flavors of light herbs, bouillon and savory mushroom. Sophisticated and detailed, this wine offers plenty of length and development.

title: Bethel Heights 2016 Casteel Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: A reserve-level barrel selection, this is a deep dive into black cherry, blackberry preserves and subtle layering of herbs, coffee grounds and dark chocolate. Absolutely luscious, it complements its ripe, forward fruit with a long, lovely, detailed finish.

title: Biondi 2016 Rosso Cisterna Fuori  (Etna)
description: Ethereally elegant and tantalizing fragrant, this understated beauty opens with mesmerizing scents of strawberry, rose petal and flint. The classy, subtle palate shows remarkable pedigree, offering crunchy red cherry, mint, star anise and minerality framed in racy acidity and refined tannins. It has amazing energy as well as a compelling delicacy that keeps you coming back for more. It will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Brittan Vineyards 2015 Basalt Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Brittan's wines may seem a bit austere when first opened, which is no fault in this instance. The 2015s are a touch richer and fuller than the previous vintage, yet retain the laser focus on terroir, and specifically the basalt-driven minerality of this estate. Here are raspberries galore, with pinpoint definition. Drink now–2030 and perhaps beyond.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Pé de Mãe Red (Alentejano)
description: This richly smooth wine was fermented in open top lagars. That has the effect of rounding out the tannins and giving a wine with immense power and a generous ripe character. Black fruits, juicy acidity and a impressive concentration create a wine to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Churchill's 2016 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe blueberry fruits are balanced by the dark tannins of this rich wine. It is a powerful statement, celebrating great fruit and rich tannins. Drink this fine wine from 2028.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Mesnil Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine comes from Le Mesnil, one of the top villages in the Côte des Blancs, and is produced from only Grand Cru vineyards. It is as textured and mineral as a young wine like this should be. White fruit shows through the concentrated texture and will become more dominant as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.

title: Grimaldi Bruna 2012 Badarina Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of menthol, balsamic herb, exotic spice and a floral note lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, assertive close-grained tannins provide the backbone for dried black cherry, licorice and espresso. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Mastroberardino 2015 Stilèma  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: The latest in Mastroberardino's lineup, this gorgeous, mineral-driven white delivers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, oyster shell, a hint of toasted almond, saline and a smoky note that's present in the greatest expressions of Fiano. Elegant and loaded with energy, this will age beautifully and develop even more complexity. To fully enjoy its depth, serve chilled but not too cold.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Broadly fleshy and expansive on the palate, this is a lovely, powerful wine, spicy in forest pine and clove. Succulent on the midpalate, it offers an array of well-defined citrus and wild strawberry, with a lingering quality to the finish that impresses in rose petal and lavender.

title: Perrier Jouët 2011 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)
description: Always a light, ethereal style of wine, this is also very fresh and still young. It will age with its taut minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. A softer background will become toasty over the next few years. The vintage date on this bottle is 200 years after the foundation of this producer. Drink from 2021.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Binger Scharlachberg Grosse Lage GG Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: This is an intensely ripe, penetrating wine full of concentrated yellow peach and even red berry notes. At the same time, it's deeply earthy with stony mineral undertones and striking acidity. Dry and full bodied in style, it finishes on a delicate fringe of tannins. A bold, satisfying wine that should improve well through 2030, likely longer.
designation: Binger Scharlachberg Grosse Lage GG Trocken

title: Quinta do Portal 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with powerful tannins, this is a dark and concentrated wine. It has sweetness as well as great ripe black fruit and a dark texture. This is a rich wine that is destined for a long aging. Drink from 2028.

title: Ruinart 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe opulent wine has rich white fruits and a warm, rounded texture. It's very much in the rich Ruinart style, made extra special by the maturity of the wine. There is still a mineral texture to the wine but the fruit has become toasty and rich. Drink now.
